title.narrative: 4.2 STRENGTHENED SOCIAL PROTECTN SYSTEM

description.narrative: 4.2: By 2018, strengthened national social protection system to address the needs of the most vulnerable children and families and to enhance resilience against shocks., which contributes to Economic And Social Policy General, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2018, child rights and equity are increasingly prioritised in social sector national and sub-national policies, budget allocation, social protection systems and public discussion.

mailing-address.narrative: No.11 Street 75 Sangkat Sraschark P.O. Box 176 Phnom Penh

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.2: By 2018, strengthened national social protection system to address the needs of the most vulnerable children and families andto enhance resilience against shocks.

description.narrative: UNICEF, in coordination with GiZ and Save the Children, supported the Ministry of Planning to pilot On-Demand Identification of the Poor (ODID) to address the exclusion error of the current IDPoor system which updates data only every three years. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2019

title.narrative: Costed scale up plan for the national CT programme for pregnant women and children in place

baseline.value: Costed scale up plan not in place

actual.value: 2019:The costed scale up plan was developed.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

actual.value: 2017:Change with the social protection governance structure (establishment of the National Social Protection Council and its secretariat) resulted in delay with work for development of national SP M&E system.

title.narrative: 2.3 Cash transfers: Existence of legislation on cash transfer programmes and/or family benefits

actual.value: 2019:National Social Protection Policy Framework 2016-25 approved and CT for pregnant women and children will be in place in 2019 with 5 million USD from the government.

title.narrative: National Cash Transfer programme for pregnant women and women designed

actual.value: 2019:National cash transfer programme design completed, waiting for an official government approval

title.narrative: Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

baseline.value: Revision of guidelines for SNA development plan formulation

actual.value: 2019:The social protection M & E system still to be developed.

title.narrative: Cash transfer pilot targeting pregnant women and children implemented and evaluated

actual.value: 2019:The cash transfer pilot was evaluated and lessons learnt are being used to inform the design of the national cash transfer programme.

title.narrative: National M&E system for social protection programmes with data disaggregation and budgetary information in place

actual.value: 2019:The M&E system for social protection programme not yet in place.
